metadata.synopsis: Dialog with Mattis in Haven. He's a young tiefling boy who dreams of opening up his own shop in baldur's gate. He's delighted to be given the responsibility of the 'shop' in the Last Light Inn and does his best to sound more 'grown-up' and 'formal'. But he fumbles it a bit.This is his main dialogue in Haven and covers all major states, Isobel and Mol kidnapped, the Inn attacked, tieflings dead, etc.

0.speaker: Mattis
0.text: I can't wait to get outta this dump and never come back. Grab what you can before we scarper, yeah?
0.context: NodeContext: Sigh at the beginning fo the sentence. Excited ot get out. Sick of the place.

21.speaker: Mattis
21.text: My stores are always open to you - just make sure you give Ketheric a few knocks from me, yeah?
21.context: InternalNodeContext: Nightsong arrived to Haven/dead, people know that Ketheric can be killedNodeContext: Gleeful in the thought of beating up the 'bad guy'

27.speaker: Mattis
27.text: In the market for something special?
27.context: NodeContext: 'Ahem' is said with gravitas, you're enjoying being a 'businessman'

41.speaker: Mattis
41.text: Thanks for bringing the crew back. If I open a shop in Baldur's Gate you're gonna get a discount! Not, like, a big one, but still.

43.speaker: Mattis
43.text: You had something to do with the light, right? I knew it - this is the end for Ketheric. Stock up while you can!
43.context: InternalNodeContext: Nightsong arrived to Haven/dead, people know that Ketheric can be killedNodeContext: gleeful at being right

59.speaker: Mattis
59.text: Seems like you need some extra supplies. What'll it be?
59.context: NodeContext: Little worried but trying to be 'professional'

61.speaker: Mattis
61.text: Mol can be cranky, and mean, but she looks after us. So, stock up, all right? 'Cause you need all the help you can get to bring her home.

66.speaker: Mattis
66.text: Check it out - we've gone legitimate, and Mol put me in charge. Whaddya need?

26.speaker: Player
26.context: NodeContext: Cheeky - you don't expect the player to have the coin.

70.speaker: Mattis
70.text: You got the coin this time? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
70.context: NodeContext: Cheeky - you don't expect the player to have the coin.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: You mentioned you had a key?
76.context: NodeContext: trying to sound like a professional

62.speaker: Mattis
62.context: NodeContext: trying to sound like a professional

2.speaker: Player
2.text: I'd like to buy it from you.
2.context: NodeContext: trying to sound like a professional

64.speaker: Mattis
64.text: This is a, ahem, valuable piece, so it's gonna cost a lot. And that is non-negot... non... the price isn't changing! ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
64.context: NodeContext: trying to sound like a professional

52.speaker: Player
52.text: That's way too little. Here. Keep the change. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

82.speaker: Mattis
82.text: Are you serious? Thanks so much! I've gotta tell Mol.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: You drive a hard bargain, but it's a deal. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
34.context: NodeContext: delighted. Saying 'negotiation' like it's a super posh business word

74.speaker: Mattis
74.text: Yes! That's my first negotiation. Here. Pleasure doing business with you.
74.context: NodeContext: delighted. Saying 'negotiation' like it's a super posh business word

30.speaker: Mattis
30.text: Oh no! I'm so sorry, I - I think I dropped it. This is so unprofessional, Mol is gonna kill me!
30.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking around, patting your pocketsNodeContext: upset and frustrated with yourself

12.speaker: Mattis
12.text: As Mol would say - suit yourself.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: I'll be back with the money.
15.context: NodeContext: Rolling eyes, player has said they would be back with the money once already.

47.speaker: Mattis
47.text: Better hurry, I've got loads of interested parties.
47.context: NodeContext: Rolling eyes, player has said they would be back with the money once already.

58.speaker: Mattis
58.context: NodeContext: Rolling eyes, player has said they would be back with the money once already.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Mol said I could have it.

68.text: Really? But she said... all right. Here. I guess.

8.speaker: Mattis
8.text: Really? But she said... all right. Here. I guess.

25.speaker: Mattis
25.text: Huh... No, no! Don't tell me I dropped it? I'm an idiot.
25.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking around, patting your pocketsNodeContext: surprised then mad at yourself

22.context: NodeContext: Like two kids fighting back and forth 'Nuh uh!' 'Yeah huh!'

1.speaker: Mattis
1.context: NodeContext: Like two kids fighting back and forth 'Nuh uh!' 'Yeah huh!'

73.speaker: Player
73.text: Give it or I'm telling Mol on you.

17.speaker: Mattis
17.text: Go ahead! It's mine. Got it?!

3.text: Go ahead! It's mine. Got it?!

49.speaker: Mattis
49.text: Go ahead! It's mine. Got it?!

37.text: Until she tells me that herself, I'm gonna hang onto it. Thanks.

86.speaker: Mattis
86.text: Until she tells me that herself, I'm gonna hang onto it. Thanks.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: If it was worth any coin, do you think Mol would have given it to you?
28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands over key.NodeContext: Sad. Downcast.

19.speaker: Mattis
19.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands over key.NodeContext: Sad. Downcast.

63.speaker: Mattis
63.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands over key.NodeContext: Sad. Downcast.

16.speaker: Player
16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands over key.NodeContext: Sad. Downcast.

89.text: But she put me in charge of the shop! I thought... never mind. Here. You can have it, then.
89.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands over key.NodeContext: Sad. Downcast.

18.speaker: Mattis
18.text: But she put me in charge of the shop! I thought... never mind. Here. You can have it, then.
18.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands over key.NodeContext: Sad. Downcast.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Mol knows it'll be safer with me - and so do you.

80.speaker: Mattis
80.text: No way! This is my shop - that means I'm in charge of all the stuff in the shop. And that's that.

5.text: No way! This is my shop - that means I'm in charge of all the stuff in the shop. And that's that.

39.speaker: Mattis
39.text: No way! This is my shop - that means I'm in charge of all the stuff in the shop. And that's that.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: With all the other fabulous things you've found in this inn, why hold on to a dusty old key?

71.speaker: Mattis
71.text: Hm. I guess it is kind of old. Here. Birds of a feather.

72.speaker: Mattis
72.text: Hm. I guess it is kind of old. Here. Birds of a feather.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Look - give it to me now, or I steal it later. The former is less embarrassing.

65.text: She always says the stuff I like is junk. I'm gonna make a killing on this! You'll see.

4.speaker: Mattis
4.text: She always says the stuff I like is junk. I'm gonna make a killing on this! You'll see.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Take good care of that key.

85.speaker: Mattis
85.text: Don't worry - it isn't leaving my sight!

48.speaker: Player
48.text: You got any stock for an extra special customer like me?

9.speaker: Mattis
9.text: Hmm. I'm not supposed to mention it to anyone, but I do have something pretty special in stock. A key.

54.speaker: Mattis
54.text: What does it look like? What does it open? What treasures await behind its lock? That's for one lucky buyer to find out.

84.speaker: Mattis
84.text: Mol gave it to me, said I shouldn't let it go to just any old jack-a-day.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: Mol mentioned some 'silver junk' she'd found?
50.context: NodeContext: Very dodger oliver twist, hamming it up a bit

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Yours is the first happy face I've seen in a good while.
36.context: NodeContext: Very dodger oliver twist, hamming it up a bit

53.speaker: Mattis
53.text: I'm alive, ain't I? What's not to like.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Let me see what you have.
38.context: NodeContext: Very dodger oliver twist, hamming it up a bit

81.speaker: Mattis
81.context: NodeContext: Very dodger oliver twist, hamming it up a bit

87.speaker: Mattis
87.context: NodeContext: Very dodger oliver twist, hamming it up a bit

88.speaker: Mattis
88.text: I want to go back. Back to the way things were... What can I get you?
88.context: NodeContext: Your friends are dead. Upset and grieving. Trying to get it together. Trying to shake it off and be professional in second setence.
